  • Description: GATX 74170 was found to be leaking from the BOV. It is a slight drip in the early morning when it is the coldest. The secondary containment nozzle/plug was found to be missing when it arrived in the Belen, NM yard. Have been awaiting parts from the shipper to repair the car. Leak is being contained with a plastic bag until repairs can be made to the car.

item.title: Report X-2024010565
item.description:
Report X-2024010565

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING FROM THE CORNER OF THE BOX WAS DISCOVERED BY THE HVD PICKOFF ON THE PD 4. THE PICKOFF STOPPED THE BELT, SECURED IT, LOCKED IT, TESTED IT, THEN LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED THE SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE LID ON ONE OF THE PLASTIC 2.5 LITER INNER CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 TURN AND 2 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLE WALLED FIPERBOARD BOX AND THERE WAS NO INNER PACKAGING.

item.title: Report E-2024010440
item.description:
Report E-2024010440

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 18, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was punctured by a skid and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the top of the drum and cardboard underneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel utilized a chemical pump to transfer the contents of the damaged 55-gallon drum into a new 55-gallon drum. Crews then utilized one (1) 95-gallon open top drum to overpack and contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. EWI personnel collected the damaged cardboard for disposal. Crews staged the new drum onsite to be handled by R+L personnel. R+L personnel took possession of the waste to be added to the facility waste stream.

item.title: Report X-2024010597
item.description:
Report X-2024010597

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-20
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY A SORTER IN PRIMARY SORT AISLE-3. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 1 POLY 1-GALLON JUGS WAS LOOSE BY A FULL ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 6 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE AND FOLLOWING DECISION TREE, RESPONDER RESPONDED TO TRAILER, PLACED PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TRAY AND RETURNED TO PROCESSING CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THAT THE INTERNAL BOXES WERE MARKED WITH CORROSIVE PICTOGRAM. THE LABEL SAID THE PRODUCT CONTAINED PHOSPHORIC ACID. IT TESTED AS A 0 ON THE PH SCALE. THERE WERE NO MARKINGS OF ANY KIND ON THE OUTER BOX. UNDECLARED HAZMAT DISCOVERED. HMSC CONFIRMED. UNDECLARED PROTOCOL WAS FOLLOWED.

item.title: Report E-2024010441
item.description:
Report E-2024010441

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: JAMAICA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: JET BLUE AIRWAYS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While boarding flight 149 JFK to GND. The FO and CA were waiting for refueling to be completed before doing the before start checked to the line. The F3, came in the cockpit and said there was a medical issue he then corrected and said safety issue in the jetway. The CA was walking into the galley was told it was a bag fire in the jetway. When he stepped into the jetway, he observed a wet bag, 2 empty water bottles, and fire extinguisher, next to an open bag. It had a blue battery disconnected from the bag. The F1 was watching over it with fire gloves. The CA then asked all in the jetway (starting to get crowded) if fire rescue was notified and was told ops knows about it. He immediately went into the cockpit and called ground operations to let them know they were had a bag fire in the jetway that appeared to be out. He also mentioned that he believed ops had informed Port authority but would confirm. He called OPS on the radio and they knew. He asked them to call the Port Authority to have the bag looked at. They said they would. On his way back to the jetway he noticed all the customers were in their seats he checked on the bag. No fire and then made a PA to let the customers know all was safe and what had happened. After things settled down it became clear to me what an amazing job the Flight attendants did. The F1 said she observed the customer walking down the jetway rolling a smoking bag. She stoped the customer prevented the bag from getting on the aircraft and called for safety team on the PA. She and the team went into action and by the time I got to the jetway, they had the fire out the battery cooled with water and the customers in their seats. Obviously the aircraft passageway was initially clogged with bags customers etc. that was cleared and the F3 got to the cockpit to let us know about the issue. I cant say enough about how well the flight attendants did. The suitcase was found to contain a medical refrigerator, manufactured by North Sciences. The battery connected to the refrigerator was a 120 wH, Lithium Ion Battery. It's only markings were as follows: Stirling Engine Li-ion Battery Model: JCB2405A Rated: 24V-5000mAh-120Wh Date: 2021-7 All other markings were in foreign language. The bag also contained a Power Supply Unit, manufacturer unknown. It had a Lithium Ion battery rated at 257.52 Wh. It did not go into thermal runaway and did not contribute to the event. Both items were confiscated and placed on internal reports DGR53-24 (battery) and DGR64-24 (Power Supply).

  • Description: On January 16, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of gun wash (UN1993) were punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of products to the trailer interior and adjacent boxes of masking paper. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the gun wash fluid-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, the damaged containers were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the impacted masking paper was placed into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

  • City: SELKIRK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 01/04/2024, at 1336 hours, personnel at the CSX yard in Selkirk, New York, reported product leaking from inside the valve box of car LTCX 1902, a tank car loaded with Argon, refrigerated liquid. The car was isolated and the shipper, Linde Inc., was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-0104-00121). David Scoons, a CSX Senior Manager of Hazardous Materials, responded to the incident and determined the cause of the release was a loose coupler fitting on a gauge panel feed line. Response personnel tightened the loose coupler fitting and stopped the release. The shippers representative, Timothy Lavallee (716-225-0242), was notified of the condition found and the corrective actions taken.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LJS experienced a UN3286 EC1417A release from a 350-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 1 x 1 area of the trailer floor as well as the tote body. The lid to the tote was not secure causing a release. The tote and impacted trailer floor were wiped down and cleaned with simple green. All impacted pads and PPE were then placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The crew removed and cleaned the gasket which was then reseated, they then tightened the bolts and conducted a slosh test to ensure there would be no further release. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2024010386

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: CHEROKEE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIRGAS USA, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver encountered deteriorating roadway conditions on his way to make delivery to the customer. At some point driver claims that a 3rd party driver veered into his lane causing him to take minor evasive action. This lead to loss of control when he contacted an icy road surface. The tanktruck rolled into the median where it came to rest. Ther was a rupture of a vapor valve as well as the diesel fuel tank. Luckily due to the cold weather only minor amounts of ammonia were lost through the vapor break. The police and local fire department were called to the scene to set up roadblocks and control the area. The Huntsville, AL Hazmat team eventually made it to the site to assess the situation. It was deemed feasible to set the truck upright and tow away to a remote location for product offload and depressurization. Fugitive vapors were controlled by water application by the FD. A fuel cleanup team has been assigned to remove soil and diesel fuel as well.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 19, 2024, at 2053 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LEP. It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of El Pinol 85 (Pine Oil 60%) UN1272 was released from 55-gallon metal drum due to pinhole puncture. The release impacted the dock and trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable that terminal personnel was capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on-site. The terminal did not have a drum large enough to overpack the damaged drum that was leaking. ERTS dispatched contractors to drop off an 85-gallon metal drum for terminal personnel. Once arrived, terminal personnel placed the damaged drum and all impacted absorbents into the drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: 1. X-2024010418 A HAZMAT AUDITOR CAME BY AND SAID ONE OF THE HAZMATS ON THEIR TRAM HAD A STRONG CHEMICAL SELL AND POINTED TO A HAZMAT WITH BOTH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMONS HAZARD LABELS. OPENING AND INSPECTING THE PACKAGE RESPONDER FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS. ONE OF THE CAPS WAS MISSING THE PAPER SEAL UNDERNEATH WHICH ALLOWED SOME OF THE LIQUID INSIDE TO DRIBBLE OUT AND WET A PORTION OF THE CARDBOARD INSIDE. 2. X-2024010419 AUDITOR NOTED A STRONG SMELL COMING FROM PACKAGE AND CONTACTED AUTITOR. AUDITOR REMOVED PACKAGE TO THE DMP PROCESSING FACILITY. IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT ONE INNER CONTAINER WAS MISSING THE SEAL INSERT IN THE VENTED CAP, CAUSINT THE CONTAINER TO LEAK A SMALL AMOUNT AND STAIN THE OUTER BOX. ALL CONTAINERS DISPOSED VIA DMP.

item.description:
Report X-2024010490

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-23T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY THE HCD PICK-OFF ON THE PD-4. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE TURNED OFF SECURED THE BELT, EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 6 POLY 2-LITER DISPENSER/CONTAINERS WAS SLIGHTLY AJAR, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS/IN BURSTING TEST.

item.title: Report E-2024010342
item.description:
Report E-2024010342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: BRUNSWICK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SAFETY-KLEEN SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This was the last pick up for the day and when the driver was doing his pick up the customer added more paint waste to the drum and he loaded it on his truck. The drive was about an hour back to the facility to unload for the end of the day. He arrive at approximately 1730 and when he opened the door to unload they noticed the drum was swelling up. The team at the facility emidiatly called for a team to come out and and address the container. The drum expanded to the point of failure at about 1830 before the team could arrive to address the situation. The bottom of the container failed and the contents was released into the truck with around 10 gallons making it to the pavement. They were able to contained it with absorbents and booms from spreading. The team arrived around 1930 to perform the clean up. They dawned the proper PPE and proceeded to clean up the material and overpacking the container to be shipped and disposed of properly. The crew was able to complete this around 2200.

  • Description: On January 11, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3266 was damaged due to improper loading and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green Site Services Group (GSSG) to remediate the impacted site. GSSG personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) cubic yard box. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: On January 11, 2024, four (4) one-gallon bottles of sodium hydroxide were crushed in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel deployed soda ash and absorbent pads to the sodium hydroxide-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and impacted cardboard were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum. An additional 35-gallon drum was used to contain the damaged 1-gallon jugs and both were set aside for terminal disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNJ reported a 5-ounce release of UN1230 Pro Methanol from a 55-gallon metal drum. The damaged drum was placed into a 65-gallon poly drum. Contractors were dispatched to place the drum into a compatible container. Contractors arrived onsite and advised they did not observe a release to the poly overpack. The damaged drum was removed from the poly overpack, patched, and re-overpacked into an 85-gallon metal drum. The poly overpack the drum was staged in was then cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum as a precaution. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On December 19, 2023, at 0711 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by A Duie Pile personnel in Newburgh, NY regarding the release of an unknown amount of various products due to a multiple vehicle accident (The speed of the vehicle is unknown). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of multiple materials which included KEM AQUA 400 Waterborne Enamel (UN1263, 3, III), Polane Plus Enamel (Part A) (UN1263, 3, III), and a Flammable Liquid, Corrosive, n.o.s. (UN1263, 3, II). Contractors were unable to assess approximately how much of each were released due to the materials mixing with each other. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized in (7) 55-gallon poly drum, and (7) 55-gallon metal drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Broken pallet was removed from the package flow and brought to for QA inspection. Upon inspection, package contained Dyno Battery (50-25 industrial cell) packaged on top of a small wooden pallet wrapped in plastic wrap. There was no hazmat labeling or markings on the package. DescribePack: Wooden pallet was broken, and the battery had spilled out some of its content from inside. The cause of the damage is unknown. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated from the package flow, and it was immediately placed inside a salvage drum after inspection.

  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of (1) 330 gallon metal tote containing NALCO EC5407A (UN1993), which arrived at the terminal with a loose lid and spilled approximately 5 ounces onto the side of the tote and onto the floor of the trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, it was decided the spill could be cleaned in house with terminal issued PPE. The terminal cleaned the spill with absorbents and placed the contents into an 8 gallon metal drum and left in the waste area.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported an 8 oz. release of UN3266, Perform XXL Booster due to a puncture caused by a faulty nail inside of a trailer from terminal LDA. The damaged container, a 65-gallon DF, was turned upside down and the release was contained to the top of the drum. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt confident overpacking the damaged drum into an 85-gallon DF and it was left onsite as waste for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023120477
item.description:
Report E-2023120477

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-25
  • City: RAPHINE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RDX, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 25, 2023, at 1645 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by RDX, LLC personnel in Raphine, Virginia regarding the release of approximately (5) gallon of Professional Wire Wheel Cleaner (Corrosive Liquid, Toxic, N.O.S. (UN2922, 8, II) from (1) 55-gallon poly drums. Contractors were dispatched and upon arrival, contractors confirmed the material and the amount of the release. Contractors were able to to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE, and the leaking drum's top was tighten and secured to be forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024010408
item.description:
Report E-2024010408

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-25T00:35:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Due to a forklift accident, a 55-gallon poly drum containing ChemTreat BL1544 was punctured and released approximately 10-gallons of product onto the concrete, dock floor and asphalt beneath the trailer. A contractor overpacked the damaged drum and neutralized the spilled product with Kolorsafe Base Neutralizer. The spill debris was placed into (2) 55DF's for waste disposal along with the overpack drum. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.
